primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: God bridges the infinite gap between a perfectly righteous Judge and a sinful humanity by removing sins and placing Himself under judgment in man's place.

tekstueel_bewijs: the destiny of the entire human race depends upon God alone

tegenstander.identificatie: Sin / Judgment / Human Pride / The Gap
tekstueel_bewijs: The gap between us and a perfectly righteous God is just too great
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponent is not just bad behavior but an ontological gap and a divine judgment that no human effort can bridge.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The enactment of holiness and mercy within the Christian community as a response to grace.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Believer / The Church
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: Holiness is described as an 'enactment' of the future already secured by God; it follows the primary program of justification.

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon emphasizes human 'non-pouvoir' (inability) and God's 'pouvoir' (sovereign power to save and change hearts).

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: Moves from the fear of S2 (Judgment) through the failure of ~S1 (Works/Moralism) to the resolution in S1 (Grace).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: Christ occupies S2 (Judgment) to grant S1 (Mercy) to those in ~S1.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: High; judgment is described as a 'deadly earnest' reality.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon consistently identifies God as the primary actor in salvation and even in the sanctification process (removing grudges while the subject sleeps).

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: How many homeless people have I helped this week?

indicatoren_genade.indicator: God as Subject of active verbs
indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: He has submitted to the Judgment in our place.
The gap... is just too great, unless he makes the move.

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Biblical figures are not used as moral models but as fellow recipients of judgment/grace.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: Theocentric: Paul is the one warning, but God is the one justifying.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Relief and shift from self-scrutiny to God-reliance.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The transition from the 'Primary Program' (Justification) to the 'Secondary Program' (Ethics) is handled by defining ethics as an 'enactment' of the future God has already created.
spanning_punten: The tension between 'taking holiness seriously' and 'God doing it in our sleep'.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: has submitted to the Judgment in our place.

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: Endowment (removing the grudge without human effort).

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Fatal; life-ruining; creates an unbridgeable gap.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon is a robust example of theocentric narrative where God is the Subject of the rescue and the Hearer is the Receiver.

modale_halans.voorgestelde_balans: Maintain current balance; it serves the grace-orientation.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: This sermon masterfully avoids the trap of 'grace-as-a-work' by keeping God as the active Subject even in the internal transformation of the believer.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: While rhetoric might focus on the use of the AIDS anecdote for pathos, semiotics reveals that the woman functions as a 'Receiver' who lacks 'Pouvoir', mirroring the congregation.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis explains Romans 14; semiotics shows how the sermon 'performs' the theology of Romans 14 by stripping the hearer of the 'Subject' role in their own salvation.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: The 'Subject-switch' at the end (Christ taking the place of the Subject under Judgment) is the structural engine of the sermon's power.

volledige_subject_lijst: God (does not deal according to sins)
appendices.notities: The sermon uses the 'strong/weak' actantial roles from the text to deconstruct the hearer's self-sufficiency.
